goals.question: What is the distribution of penguin species in the dataset?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of the count of each penguin species
goals.rationale: This helps us understand the proportion of each species in the dataset and if there is any class imbalance.

goals.question: What is the average body mass of each penguin species?
goals.visualization: Grouped box plot of body mass by species
goals.rationale: This helps us compare the body mass of each species and identify any significant differences.

goals.question: What is the relationship between flipper length and body mass?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of flipper length vs body mass
goals.rationale: This helps us identify any correlation between flipper length and body mass and if there is any linear relationship.

goals.question: What is the distribution of bill length for each penguin species?
goals.visualization: Violin plot of bill length by species
goals.rationale: This helps us compare the distribution of bill length for each species and identify any significant differences.

goals.question: What is the relationship between bill depth and body mass?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of bill depth vs body mass
goals.rationale: This helps us identify any correlation between bill depth and body mass and if there is any linear relationship.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    chart = sns.countplot(x="species", data=data)
    chart.set(title="What is the distribution of penguin species in the dataset?")
    return chart

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.dropna(subset=['body_mass_g'])
    chart = sns.boxplot(x='species', y='body_mass_g', data=data)
    chart.set_title('What is the average body mass of each penguin species?', wrap=True)
    chart.axhline(data['body_mass_g'].mean(), color='red', label=f"Mean: {data['body_mass_g'].mean():.2f}")
    chart.legend()
    return chart

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='body_mass_g', y='flipper_length_mm')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between flipper length and body mass?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.dropna(subset=['bill_length_mm'])
    sns.violinplot(x='species', y='bill_length_mm', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of bill length for each penguin species?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='bill_depth_mm', y='body_mass_g')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between bill depth and body mass?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
